sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a circle.
message_1: A circular track has a radius of 10 meters. What is the perimeter of the track (in meters) if a runner makes one complete lap around it?
message_2:
The perimeter of a circular track is given by the formula P = 2πr, where P is the perimeter and r is the radius of the circle.

In this case, the radius r = 10 meters. So, the perimeter P = 2π(10) = 20π meters.

Therefore, the perimeter of the track is 20π meters, which is approximately 62.83 meters if a runner makes one complete lap around it.
